DataElement.preferredName: Hospital Confidential National Provider Identifier Referred To Facility Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The NPI (National Provider Identifier) code that identifies the facility to which the patient was referred for further care after discharge from the reporting facility.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hospital Confidential National Provider Identifier Referred To Facility
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The facility to which the patient was referred for further care after discharge from the reporting facility.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.:The ethical principle or legal right that a physician or other health professional will hold secret all information relating to a patient, unless the patient gives consent permitting disclosure.

Concepts.definition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.

Treatment of information so that it is not divulged in ways that are inconsistent with the understanding of the original disclosure. Particularly, the ethical principle or legal right that a physician or other health professional will hold secret all information relating to a patient, unless the patient gives consent permitting disclosure.

Property.preferredName: National Provider Identifier Referring To Facility
Property.preferredDefinition: A system for uniquely identifying all providers of health care services, supplies, and equipment. NPIs are assigned by the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) and are 10-position, all-numeric identification numbers that will identify a health care provider in standard transactions, such as health care claims.:Sending or directing for treatment, information, or a decision.:No Value Exists:Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry.

Concepts.definition: A unique identification number for health care services, supplies, and equipment providers in the United States.  NPI is assigned for use in all administrative and financial transactions specified by HIPAA. NPI is issued by the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) and is 10-position, all-numeric identification number with no embedded intelligence.
Sending or directing for treatment, information, or a decision.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A system for uniquely identifying all providers of health care services, supplies, and equipment. NPIs are assigned by the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) and are 10-position, all-numeric identification numbers that will identify a health care provider in standard transactions, such as health care claims._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system for uniquely identifying all providers of health care services, supplies, and equipment. NPIs are assigned by the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) and are 10-position, all-numeric identification numbers that will identify a health care provider in standard transactions, such as health care claims.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A unique identification number for health care services, supplies, and equipment providers in the United States.  NPI is assigned for use in all administrative and financial transactions specified by HIPAA. NPI is issued by the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) and is 10-position, all-numeric identification number with no embedded intelligence.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: NPI--Inst Referred To Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: NPI, a unique identification number for health care providers, is scheduled for 2007-2008 implementation by the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) as part of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA). For billing purposes large practices and large group providers will be required to use NPI codes by May 2007; small health plans will be required to use NPI codes by May 2008. When a facility starts to use the NPI codes, that information should be transmitted in the appropriate NPI data items.
